column4: for some reason i have no internet access from my ubuntu machine. i get an ip from the router, but that's about it. can someone help me with that? (im a windows user usually) - how can i for example check my defauly gateway settings?
stef, nope, i tried google.com's ip.
got it... still chewing on it
how can i check my default gateway?
yup that's incorrect:) how can i change the default gateway?
Psycode just edit the file with root privilegs and save it
anything i need to do for changes to take affect?
sudo ifdown eth*, sudo ifup eth*
or whatever your NIC is called
doesn't help :( is there a different way to check my current gateway? (not the config file itself)
there's a GUI-applet for it in System-Admin-Network
that's a bit of a problem since i can only access its shell :\
no, then all you can do is edit the config-file
but a reboot should fix it, if the gateway is right then
a reboot did the job :) thanks!
